overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to short time-series forecasting with limited data. The analyst systematically evaluates multiple methods (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing) but ultimately selects a simple averaging technique due to data constraints. The approach prioritizes daily seasonality capture through hourly averaging, with careful attention to data completeness, outlier impacts, and output formatting.
common_data_patterns: Hourly temperature fluctuations (drops at night, rises during day)
key_insights: Limited data (4 days) restricts complex model application (SARIMA/Holt-Winters)
Daily profile averaging effectively handles short-term seasonality with minimal data
Rounding forecasts to match input data precision (3 decimals) is essential
Reshaping data into 4x24 matrix enables efficient hourly pattern extraction
Recursive forecasting is avoided due to lack of future actuals
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with thorough method evaluation: initial consideration of advanced statistical models, detailed data pattern examination, and multi-step averaging implementation, but simplified due to data limitations.
